text: In the 250 years of its active evolution Funerary Violin moved from the formal to the personal. It is clear from the earliest  practices  accounts  experiments  struggles  accounts  of the form that its role during the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries was largely heraldic: to  exemplify  signify  clarify  simplify  exemplify  the continuity of the social structure. The few works that have survived from this period are often  commonly  conventionally  surprisingly  expectedly  surprisingly  unemotional and at times overtly  insignificant  trivial  irrelevant  grandiose  grandiose  .
